problem:
For real numbers $t,$ the point
\[(x,y) = (\cos t, \cos 2t)\]is plotted.  All the plotted points lie on what kind of curve?

(A) Line
(B) Circle
(C) Parabola
(D) Ellipse
(E) Hyperbola

Enter the letter of the correct option.
solution:
Note that
\[y = \cos 2t = 2 \cos^2 t - 1 = 2x^2 - 1,\]so all the plotted points lie on a parabola.  The answer is $\boxed{\text{(C)}}.$
